Ekonomi Lesu Bikin Pengusaha Ogah Ekspansi Bisnis
05 Nov 2019, 06:41 by Trio Hamdani


Ilustrasi/Foto: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - Pengusaha memilih menahan diri untuk melakukan ekspansi bisnis di tengah lesunya pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional. Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia di kuartal III-2019 sebesar 5,02%. Sementara proyeksi pemerintah adalah 5,2% hingga akhir 2019.Ketua Umum Kamar Dagang dan Industri (Kadin) Indonesia Rosan P. Roeslani menjelaskan saat ini pengusaha memilih untuk menunda ekspansi. Bila ekonomi sudah tumbuh baik baru mereka akan ekspansi kembali."Iya kita menahan dulu (untuk melakukan ekspansi bisnis)," kata Rosan di Hotel Indonesia Kempinski, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).Dia menjelaskan hal tersebut dipengaruhi oleh supply and demand atau penawaran dan permintaan. Bila permintaan sedikit maka pengusaha tidak akan melakukan ekspansi. Sebaliknya, bila permintaan meningkat maka mereka akan ekspansi."Kembali lagi hukumnya supply and demand. Begitu demand-nya lemah kita akan ekspansi nggak? pasti akan nahan. Begitu demand-nya tinggi apa kita akan lebih ekspansi? Iya," terangnya.Sebelum melakukan ekspansi, pengusaha sudah memprediksi bagaimana geliat pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesi."Kita sudah prediksi nih perekonomian akan stagnan, apa kita akan ekspansi? Ya nggak, gitu. Tapi kalau kita prediksi (pertumbuhan ekonomi) ini akan meningkat, dari sekarang kita ekspansi. Kalau kita melihatnya seperti itu saja kok," tambahnya. Sluggish Economy Makes Entrepreneurs Unwilling Business Expansion
05 Nov 2019, 06:41 by Trio Hamdani


Illustration / Photo: Agung Pambudhy

Jakarta - Businessmen choose to refrain from doing business expansion amid sluggish national economic growth. The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) recorded Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 of 5.02%. While the government's projection is 5.2% until the end of 2019. Indonesian General Chairman of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) Rosan P. Roeslani explained that at this time employers chose to postpone expansion. When the economy grows well then they will expand again. "Yes, we will hold back first (to expand the business)," Rosan said at the Hotel Indonesia Kempinski, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). He explained that this was influenced by supply and demand or supply and demand. If there is little demand, entrepreneurs will not expand. Conversely, if demand increases, they will expand. "Again, the law is supply and demand. Once demand is weak, we will expand, right? It will definitely hold back. When demand is high, will we expand further? Yes," he explained. expansion, entrepreneurs have predicted how stretched Indonesia's economic growth. "We have predicted that the economy will stagnate, will we expand? Yes no, that is. But if we predict (economic growth) this will increase, from now we will expand. If we see it just like that, "he added.
